What does S3 stand for?
column3: S3 is AWS's object storage with virtually unlimited scale and 11 9s durability.

column1: What type of storage is Amazon S3?
column3: Objects = data + metadata + key; not block or file storage; ideal for backups, logs, static assets.

column1: S3 durability for Standard class is approximately?
column3: Designed for 11 9s object durability across multiple AZs.

column1: Is Amazon S3 strongly consistent?
column2: Yes, strong read-after-write consistency for all operations
column3: Since Dec 2020, PUT/DELETE/LIST/GET reflect latest state immediately.

column1: Max single object size in S3?
column3: Single PUT is up to 5 GB; use multipart upload for larger files.

column1: When should you use multipart upload?
How many buckets per account by default?
column3: Request quota increase if needed; object count per bucket is unlimited.

column1: S3 static website endpoints support which protocol?
column3: Use CloudFront for HTTPS on custom domains over S3 website hosting.

column1: Which AWS service should you use to globally cache S3 content?
column3: Use Origin Access Control (OAC) or OAI to keep buckets private.

column1: How to grant temporary public access to a private object?
column3: Generate time-limited URL with required permissions; avoid public ACLs.

column1: S3 server-side encryption options?
column3: SSE-S3 uses AES-256; KMS adds key policies/audit; SSE-C uses customer-provided keys.

column1: Encryption in transit for S3 uses?
column3: Always use HTTPS for API and signed URL access.

column1: Requester Pays: who pays for data transfer and requests?
Is S3 suitable for running a database?
column3: Use EBS/EFS/RDS for DBs; S3 is object storage not block/file.

column1: Are EBS snapshots stored in S3, and how?
column3: Only changed blocks are saved after the first full snapshot.

column1: Transfer Acceleration endpoint format?
column3: Example: https://s3-accelerate.amazonaws.com; enables long-haul speedups via AWS edge.

S3 replication supports which destinations?
column2: Same or different accounts; single or multiple destination buckets
column3: Can set storage class; replicate delete markers; use Batch Replication for existing objects.
